description: It’s German for “Yeast Wheat Beer”.  We brew our Hefeweizen in the Bavarian tradition using the yeast from Weinstephan, the oldest brewery in Germany.  This is an unfiltered, slightly cloudy, beer that features a strong stand of foam, a delicate round malt and wheat presence and finishes with no regrets. You might notice an aroma of banana and clove, you might not, not everyone sniffs their beer.

breweries.description: Here at Carbondale Craft Beer, we are beer lovers, too and we know every beer lover demands a high quality craft beer. Our brewery, in Southern Illinois, delivers the finest examples of American craft beer with each and every pint that bears the "Little Egypt" name.
breweries.name: Carbondale Craft Beer

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

name: Hefeweizen

description: Our Hef brewed with true German yeast

breweries.description:
Birdsview Brewing Company started in July 2006.  It is a small family run craft brewery located in the beatuiful North Cascades in NW Washington State.

Kids & families are always welcome inside.  The outdoor beer garden is 21 and over

description: Brewed with 40 percent wheat and a special yeast gives this German classic subtle tones of banana and clove. Brewed traditionally during the summer months, it is unfiltered so its’ full of vitamin B from the yeast and served with a lemon wedge just like in the Deutsche land.

breweries.description: We are proudly located at the corner of Toole and 16th St. Come on down and try any or all of our fresh microbrews, we have up to 12 on tap for all of your drinking pleasure. Combine the beer with our food, and you’ll have the recipe for a great night.

breweries.description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales.  In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers.  With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.

description: The standard by which all other wheat beers are judged. Our award-winning American-style Hefeweizen is a unique take on the traditional Bavarian classic. This refreshingly unfiltered wheat ale delivers a distinctively smooth flavor worth savoring with friends.

breweries.description: Old North State is the only winery in the state of North Carolina that is a licensed brewery. Our American Style Pale Ale uses Hops grown in Oregon with only natural products and whole grains in our production. Our hand crafted Ales are made in small batches and are available on tap at our tasting bar.

description:
Translated literally as “yeast wheat,” Hefeweizen is a traditional Bavarian wheat beer that’s customarily top fermented. It’s unfiltered, resulting in a hazy gold color matching summer’s late afternoon rays, and highly carbonated for a refreshing mouthfeel. This craft beer offers aromas and flavors of clove and banana. 

Our 2010 batch garnered a gold award in the Lallemand Brain of Brewers contest in 2010.

breweries.description: Ashland's only full service brewpub is housed in an historic building with a light industrial character. We offer our own freshly brewed handcrafted ales and lagers, including seasonal and other specialty brews.  All Standing Stone Ales are made here at the brewery in ten barrel batches using over 80% organic malts.

breweries.description:
We are an artisan nanobrewery offering a selection of fine ales, each handcrafted in a small batch. Our products will rotate pretty heavily, but we will always have at least 3-4 beers available, and something for most tastes.

Upon our opening we will be only the second brewery in Blair County and the FIRST brewery in the City of Altoona since the 1970s.

Our beers will be available at finer establishments in the area and directly from our tasting room where you can sample beers, and purchase growler fills and merchandise. We will begin offering some bottled products in the fall of 2013.
breweries.name: Railroad City Brewing Company

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. description: Our classic Hefeweizen is brewed in the traditional German manner. The malt bill is primarily composed of German wheat. Hop additions are kept low to accentuate the yeast characteristics. Bright sunny aromas of banana and clove mingle with a light bodied golden wheat flavor. Notes of fresh citrus also come forth through the lively carbonation. Traditionally unfiltered. Best enjoyed with brunch, lunch, or anytime several beers are preferable to one strong beer!

breweries.description:
A family owned and operated craft brewery and restaurant, created as a result of our long and deepening love for both craft beer and food. WRB was born through the deep desire of the owners to create a gathering space for other craft beer and food lovers in the downtown Columbus community. Our goal is to build a microbrewery and restaurant that becomes a proud member of the community, where we provide our patrons with the best possible dining and drinking experience.

Our wonderful staff and team strive to offer the highest quality craft beer and a casual, comfortable restaurant environment inspired by a new American menu featuring fresh and seasonal ingredients.
breweries.name: Wolf's Ridge Brewing

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. name: Hefeweizen

description: A traditional German wheat beer with a yeast forward flavor with notes of clove and banana.

breweries.description:
At 4204 Main Street Brewing Company we believe simple and amazing food and beer pairing is a staple in life and we wanted to share that. Our neighborhood restaurant and brewery is a place to meet, experience amazing food, carefully brewed local beer and to enjoy life. Whether you love food or you love beer you’ve come to the right place. We are here for the food and beer lovers just like us.
 
We have a unique atmosphere at Main Street and a menu that compliments our beers. From light and sweet to heavy and bitter, you can find a beer here that suits your taste. Come in and enjoy one of these locally crafted beers. Keep coming back to find out about our latest beers and menu items.
 
Our outside patio is dog friendly!
breweries.name: Main Street Brewing

breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

description: Our Hefeweizen is a light, unfiltered wheat beer, often served with a wedge of lemon. Made with thirty percent American winter wheat, Hefeweizen is balanced with sweet golden malted barley and Tettnang hops from Oregon that evoke a hint of spice. The American ale yeast is subtle, but the grains take center stage and, when left in the unfiltered beer, gives it that classic cloudiness and additional body.

description: This unfiltered Southern German-style wheat beer is an amazing summer thirst quencher. True Bavarian yeast leaves this beer slightly sweet, fruity and spicy with notes of banana as well as clove

breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times
breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store

style.description: The German word Bernsteinfarben means amber colored, and as such, a Bernsteinfarbenes Weizen is dark yellow to amber in color. This beer style is characterized by a distinct sweet maltiness and caramel or bready character from the use of medium colored malts. Estery and phenolic elements of this Weissbier should be evident but subdued. Bernsteinfarbenes Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated, and hop bitterness is low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent. The percentage of wheat malt is at least 50 percent. If this is served with yeast, the beer may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Bernsteinfarbenes Weizen / Weissbier

name: Hefeweizen

description:
Jump on the banana boat bandwagon

This German-inspired wheat ale is the perfect hot weather beer. The yeast gives the beer banana and clove aromas while finishing with a slight lemon flavor and at 4.4% ABV you don’t have to feel guilty about having more than one. Drink on my friend.

breweries.description: Falls City Beer is back! An old Louisville favorite has returned with a whole new recipe. Falls City Original Pale Ale is now available at dozens of local bars and restaurants. The new brew is made in the style of Falls City Pale Ale from the 1930’s. Falls City began as a craft beer in 1905, made in small batches with only the finest ingredients. As we start again, 105 years later, we are once again a craft beer with a commitment to quality and taste.
breweries.name: Falls City Brewing Company

description: A German wheat beer.  Banana and clove aroma and flavor (Silver Medal 2013 Colorado State Fair)

hops.description: American hops sold as Tettnanger hops often claim to be the same cultivar as the famous German aroma hop Tettnang Tettnanger. However, in recent years, it has been discovered that these hops are genetically distinct from the German landrace and in fact are most likely Fuggle or a closely related hop. The most likely explanation is that American hop growers imported the so-called Swiss Tettnanger hops, which may also have been Fuggle hops misrepresented as Tettnanger for marketing purposes. In recent years, a few growers have tried growing true Tettnanger hops in the United States, but because of the confusion of names, these are almost impossible to find or identify.
hops.name: Tettnanger (American)

breweries.description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.

breweries.description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.
breweries.name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

name: Hefeweizen

description: Queen City Hefeweizen: Queen City’s unfiltered wheat beer, produced exclusively from German malt, wheat, and hops, is complex and refreshing. The large percentage of wheat provides a pleasant creaminess and long-lasting head, while our distinctive yeast produces subtle banana- and clove-like notes in both the aroma and flavor, which perfectly balance the bready character of the malt. (ABV 5.8% IBU 23)

breweries.description: 15 barrel brew operation.

foodPairings: Almost anything goes well with Hefeweizen, but it especially shines when paired with salads and omelets.
description: An authentic example of a Bavarian Hefeweizen. “Hefe” means cloudy or yeasty and “weizen” means wheat. This beer is made with mostly wheat and uses a true Hefeweizen yeast that gives it a fruity, banana aroma with just a hint of cloves. The tart finish makes this the perfect summer beer.

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

name: Hefeweizen

breweries.description: Yazoo Brewing began as just a dream, stoked by years of homebrewing in the basement. Linus and Lila Hall moved to Nashville from Mississippi in 1996, with Linus going to work as a tire engineer for Bridgestone and Lila as a curator for the Parthenon. Trying to make tires more round proved to be less fulfilling than making great beer, so with the encouragement of Lila, Linus quit his job, got a business degree from Vanderbilt and a craft-brewing education through a course at the American Brewer's Guild, and did an internship under Garrett Oliver at Brooklyn Brewery. Linus found a used 10 bbl brewing system from a brewpub in Iowa that had gone out of business, and went to work restoring a corner of the old Marathon Motorworks building for their brewery. Yazoo Brewing opened for business in Oct 2003, and quickly gained an enthusiastic local following.

description: Our German "Spring" Wheat is lighter and more mild than our Autumn Wheat. Very flavorful, this unfiltered "witbier" is classically cloudy and exceptionally well balanced!

breweries.description:
In 1990 Larry came up with the idea to sell produce from the corner of Rt. 463 and Lower State Road. He took Dani and the three kids to meet the owner of the property, Al Walters. Mr. Walters took an immediate liking to the Jones family and allowed Dani and Larry to sell produce from his corner. Being a farmer, he even started growing corn and other vegetables for them. One day, Larry's father showed up with a bushel of live crabs and left them with Dani to sell. The crabs sold so fast that they picked up more crabs, shrimp, and other types of seafood too. In 1994, Mr. Walters passed away and Dani and Larry had to move on to bigger and better things. They rented a space in the Chalfont Village Shopping Center and opened a restaurant and fresh fish market. Dani and Larry did all the cooking. Larry would go to the fish market daily to ensure the freshest seafood. And with the help of loyal family and friends, Jones Family Seafood became a popular seafood restaurant in the area.
    Early in 2001, Larry received a mailing, the kind we all ignore, advertising "Brew your own beer". He was immediately hooked. After convincing Dani that this was a good idea, they met up with a "brew master", ordered the equipment, and they were on their way.
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
breweries.name: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. name: Hefeweizen

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: An authentic Bavarian-style unfiltered wheat beer. The German yeast we use imparts subtle banana and clove flavors that are very refreshing. A cloudy golden-orange hue, Hefeweizen is known world-wide as the quintessential warm-weather beer.

breweries.description:
The South Street Brewery was founded in 1998, and is housed in the renovated H. H. Hankins Hay and Grain warehouse built in the late 1800’s. Old brick walls, hardwood floors and thick timber pillars provide a striking setting for our custom built brewhouse and a spacious, welcoming atmosphere in which to enjoy our fresh, handcrafted ales and lagers as well as our seasonal fare.
Our commitment to on-premises brewing ensures that only the highest quality ingredients are used and that the beer is always fresh. This commitment has earned us regional and international praise but more importantly, results in a wide selection of styles and new, creative recipes that we hope will continually have our customers discovering new favorites.
Our menu also reflects our dedication to originality and fresh ingredients. We offer a seasonal menu as well as nightly specials, including an eclectic sampling of Contemporary American, Asian-Pacific, Continental, Creole, Caribbean and regional Southern dishes.
Our cuisine and libations are all served in a friendly, relaxed manner that challenges the idea that excellence necessitates pretense. We hope you enjoy your visit to South Street and that you return soon.

breweries.description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!
breweries.name: Atwater Brewery

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. description: Classic Bavarian wheat ale made with 50% malted wheat.

breweries.description:
We love brewing. We offer high quality craft beer, brewed on premises and
served directly from our tanks. Our patrons feel like they’re in the middle of a brewery...because they are. On brew day and during fermentation you will experience all the wonderful sites, smells and sounds of the brewing process.

You will find familiar and not-so-familiar styles on tap. We like to keep things interesting—there’s always something new. While somewhat conservative in the big tanks you never know what we'll put on tap for small batches. Toasted coconut stout anyone?
breweries.name: Water Street Brewing Co.

description: Unfiltered German style hefe. Light clove and banana aroma, subtle wheat and noble hop flavor with hints of citrus.

breweries.description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.
breweries.name: Chattanooga Brewing Company

style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.
style.name: American-Style Premium Lager

breweries.description: Our story is simple: we are passionate about great beer and we want to share it with others. Handcrafted in small batches with the highest quality ingredients, you can (currently) only get this beer right here in the pub. Welcome, enjoy, and please come back soon.
breweries.name: Bare Hands Brewery

style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)

description: German style wheat beer with notes of clove and banana.

breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.
breweries.name: Drafting Table Brewing Company

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. breweries.description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.

Stop in and come see what's brewing!

description: Hefeweizens are traditional German wheat beers. Notes of banana, citrus, cloves, and esters make this delightful brew’s flavor stand out and keep you coming back for more. Three Pint’s version, like the traditional German versions of yore, is an unfiltered blend that gives the beer its cloudy appearance and full flavor.

breweries.description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.
breweries.name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub

breweries.description:
Evans Brewing Company is a full scale brewing company located in Irvine, California. 

As Orange County’s oldest craft brewery and one of the largest, Evans Brewing Co. brews all of the Bayhawk Ales brands and is in the process of re-branding these beers under the Evans Brewing Company name.
After a 2 year hiatus, the Silver Medal World Beer Cup award winning Evans Lagers will also be making a return to the market. These beers will be brewed at the Irvine brewery by Summer 2015. 

Follow EBC on Instagram @evansbrewingco
breweries.name: Evans Brewing Company

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

description: “Hefe” means yeast, and “Weizen” means wheat, so Hefeweizen is “yeast wheat.”  Perfect as a session beer…definitely a must have if your a fan of German style brewing.

breweries.description:
Old 690 Brewing Company is one of the first farm breweries to open in the state of Virginia. Our mission is to brew and serve a unique yet balanced variety of fresh craft beers including several seasonal ales that utilize crops grown on the 10 acre property. Come out to beautiful Loudoun County to see our hops and enjoy our unique tasting room Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays where we serve tasting flights, pints and growlers to go. We have food trucks all weekend, but feel free to bring your own food. We are also family, kid and dog friendly. We also make and serve our own root beer!

If you are interested in hosting a special, private or corporate event please contact events@old690.com. Special event hours are available 7 days a week pending availability.

Looking forward to seeing you soon at Old 690!!
breweries.name: Old 690 Brewing Company

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. name: Hefeweizen

description: A German-styled wheat ale. Yeast creates the spicy flavor and cloudy appearance of this unfiltered ale.

breweries.description:
Turoni's Pizzery & Brewery takes great pride in serving you, and we thank you. We are dedicated to warm and friendly service to our guests by employees who give a damn. We pledge to provide the best products at the best value. If we are not proud of it we WILL NOT serve it!

Turoni's pizza has been made in Evansville for over three decades, yet never before has the recipe been reproduced by commercial establishments because of the difficulties involved in preparation.

Turoni's has been able to overcome these difficulties to share with you a freshly made pizza crust that is crisp and light enough to hold our secret sauce, gobs of gooey mozzarella cheese, and your favorite ingredients (including a few exotic ones) to make what we call "Our Specialty", Turoni's thin crust pizza. This flavor and texture makes Turoni's pizza very unique.
breweries.name: Turoni's Main Street Brewery

breweries.description: Washington DC's first brewpub since prohibition, Capitol City Brewing Co. opened its doors in 1992. Our first location still stands in Downtown DC, at 11th and H St., NW. Our company policy is to bring the fine craft of brewing to every person who lives and visits our region, as well as treating them to a wonderful meal and a great experience.

breweries.description: Wasserhund Brewing Company, meaning "water dog" in German, was born from a love of the beach, dogs, and German beer. We aspire to bring the German beer culture to Virginia Beach in the best way... by brewing the highest quality ales, lagers, and meads and providing the environment to enjoy them with family, friends, and strangers.

breweries.description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.

locations.hoursOfOperation:
Sunday -Thursday: 11 AM -11 PM (kitchen closes at 10)
Friday and Saturday: 11 AM -1 PM (kitchen closes at 11)

breweries.name: Bluegrass Brewing Company

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.
breweries.name: Live Oak Brewing Company

description: Modeled after the classic wheat beers of Bavaria, our HefeWeizen has a cloudy, straw-colored appearance with a thick, creamy head.  It is fermented with an authentic Weizenbier yeast strain which imparts delicate notes of clove, vanilla and banana which harmonize perfectly with its mild refreshing tartness. Together these flavors create the perfect thirst quencher to beat the Texas heat. Available April - August

breweries.description: Blue Frog is committed to producing traditional ales and lagers with a non-traditional twist. We use only the best ingredients to hand craft our balanced food friendly beers. Brewmaster Nick Campbell constantly tastes each batch to ensure its consistency and quality, leaning no beer released before its time. That’s commitment to quality.

Mon-Thu 11:30 am - 10 pm
Fri-Sat 11:30 am - 11 pm
Sun 11:30 am - 9 pm
locations.name: Main Brewery

breweries.name: Blue Frog Grog and Grill

description: Chocked full of wheat malts, floral German Hops and that Super Special yeast, this beer is packed with personality.

name: Hefeweizen

description: This wheat beer has a medium body with a lightly hopped profile and ends with a banana and clove finish.  Good for summer, winter, and everything in between – this classic German ale is a light colored treat any day of the week

breweries.description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.
breweries.name: Appleton Beer Factory

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. name: Hefeweizen

description: A traditionally prepared top fermented, unfiltered, amber wheat ale. A world class style that originated as an important part of brewing traditions in Bavaria Germany, and now an important of our tradition here in New York. Our beer brings out the pronounced tastes of clove and banana. To accentuate the bouquet it is best served in a tall, slender glass with plenty of room for the tall head.

breweries.description:
Founded in 2013, we pride ourselves in bringing a handcrafted beer taste here in New York State. The New Paltz region is a historical part of New York. With intense history, the name stems from the region of Pfalz, Germany. European settlers from France, via Mannheim Germany which helped develop the new found area in New York State –as the New Paltz. We feel our European style beers (hence the name Pfälzerbräu; “Brew from the Pfalz”) work very well as a premier fit in complimenting the region.

Taproom Hours:
Mon-Wed; Closed
Thu-Fri; 3pm-8pm
Sat; 12pm-8pm
Sun; 1pm-6pm
breweries.name: New Paltz Brewing Co (Pfälzerbräu)

foodPairings: Because of its racy, palate-cleansing assertiveness, it goes well with such flavorful foods as trout and salmon or a curry dish. It also goes well with a crisp, tart salad of kale, arugula or romaine.
name: Hefeweizen

breweries.description:
Wisconsin's newest packaging brewery! Located in Wisconsin Dells, WI, 1 mile East of town on Hwy 23. (Hang a right into the Business Park). Craft-brewed beer and gourmet soda-pop! Tap Room Wednesdays through Saturdays so you can check out the Brewery and have a beer or soda pop "as fresh as it gets"!! Opening soon!

Packaging Brewery with a really cool on-site Tap Room. Craft-Brewed Beer & Gourmet Soda. A Relaxing, nice place to visit!
breweries.name: Port Huron Brewing Company
